title: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor
description: Revert operation in the Java editor takes significantly longer than the close and reopen operations.
OB: When I have a dirty file open in the Java editor, I can close the file by clicking on the close box in the editor tab, select 'No' when prompted to save changes, and then reopen the file by double-clicking on it in the navigator. This process takes about 8 seconds. However, if I repeat the steps and instead choose 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original content.
SR:
1) Open the file 'org.eclipse.swt.custom.StyledText.java' from the source folder 'Eclipse SWTCustom Widgets' in the project 'org.eclipse.swt' in the open-source repository.
2) Modify the file by adding a space character at the end of the first line, marking it as dirty.
3) Close the file by clicking on the close box in the editor tab.
4) When prompted to save changes, select 'No'.
5) Reopen the file by double-clicking on it in the navigator.
6) Observe that the file opens with the changes reverted.

(Note: Repeat steps 1 and 2 before performing step 6 for comparison with close and reopen operation.)
